bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The Mothers and Daughters Club was established in 1926 to "make a bond of acquaintance between daughters of Radcliffe mothers and mothers of Radcliffe daughters." The Club had the responsibility of administering the Helen Cordelia Bunker Fund "for purposes of kindliness and service to individual girls." The Club was discontinued about 1946.

scopecontent.head: SCOPE AND CONTENT
scopecontent.p: The papers include records of the Club and corresondence.

did.unittitle: Constitution and By Laws of the Mothers and Daughters Club, 1926-1928; minutes of meetings, 1926-1932, 1945-1947; Treasurer's report, 1929-1930; lists of members; invitations and notices of meetings, 1926-1932; clippings, 1926-1932.

Correspondence of the Mothers and Daughters Club, particularly concerning the Bunker Fund, 1926-1948. Among the correspondents are J.W. Lowes, Treasurer of Radcliffe, Bernice V. Brown, Ada Comstock, Theodora Bates Cogswell, and Mrs. Arthur P. Stone, officers of the Club.
